text:
Raskolnikov looked gloomily at Svidrigaïlov. 

"You are not a bear, perhaps," he said. 

Svidrigaïlov smirked. 

"I’m not interested in anyone’s opinion," he replied, haughtily. 

"Vulgarity can be convenient," he added, laughing. 

"But you have many friends here. Why me?" Raskolnikov asked. 

"True, I have friends," Svidrigaïlov admitted. 

"I’ve seen them, but I’m sick of them." 

He paused, looking around. 

"What a town! A town of officials and students." 

His gaze sharpened. 

"My only hope now is in anatomy." 

"Anatomy?" Raskolnikov echoed, puzzled.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov expresses his disinterest in social connections and reflects on his past while contemplating his current situation.
